intro: Thlaspi alpinum var. poncinsii, commonly known as the Alpine Tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving them a distinctive appearance. Native to the alpine regions of Europe, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats.
